cac:PostalAddress.cbc:StreetName: Three Park Place, Upper Hatch Street, Dublin 2

cac:SpecificTendererRequirement.cbc:Description: For further information please see the ESPD document

cac:ProcurementProject.cbc:Name: Provision for a multiple- party supplier framework agreement for the provision of Community Energy Mentoring and Co-ordination Services to support SEAI’s Community Energy Programmes.
cac:ProcurementProject.cbc:Description: The objective of this RFT is to invite proposals from suitably qualified services providers to establish a Multiparty Framework for the provision of Mentoring and Co-ordination Services to support SEAI’s Sustainable Energy Communities, and SEAI’s SEC Team, in the delivery and development of the programme to achieve its objectives. This RFT is divided into six lots. For further information please see Request for Tender at www.etenders.gov.ie.

efac:SelectionCriteria.cbc:Description: Please reference Section 6.0 of the CfT

cac:SubordinateAwardingCriterion.cbc:Description: AC 1 Demonstrated organisation expertise with regard to the subject area
AC 2 Quality of the approach and resources to ensure effective delivery of the services
AC 3 Contract Management and Capacity to Deliver
Cost of Service

cac:ProcurementProject.cbc:Name: • Lot 1: Border/West Regional Mentoring Support Services
cac:ProcurementProject.cbc:Description:
Lots 1 – 4: The purpose these Lots is to put in place a model of service delivery through a network of community energy mentors. The mentors will be experts and advisors in place to support communities through the Learn-Plan-Do Phases of the SEC Programme. This will be achieved through the appointment of 4 Regional Co-ordinators (one for each Lot) who will supply and manage county level Mentors. SEAI intends to appoint one (1) framework member to each of the following Framework lots: • Lot 1: Border/West Regional Mentoring Support Services • Lot 2: Dublin/Mid East Regional Mentoring Support Services • Lot 3: Midlands/Southeast Regional Support Services • Lot 4: Midwest/Southwest Regional Mentoring Support Services
For further information please see Request for Tender at www.etenders.gov.ie.

cac:SubordinateAwardingCriterion.cbc:Description: AC 1 Demonstrated organisation expertise with regard to the subject area
AC 2 Quality of the approach and resources to ensure effective delivery of the services
AC 3 Contract Management and Capacity to Deliver
AC 4 Cost of Service

cac:ProcurementProject.cbc:Name: National Mentoring and Programme Support Services
cac:ProcurementProject.cbc:Description:
Lot 5: National Mentoring and Programme Support Services. The purpose of this Lot is to put in place a model of service delivery through an expert panel of national mentor and support services, to assist with programme operations, development, and evaluation, as required over the period of the Framework and any extensions. This will support the SEC programme team in advancing the development of the programme. SEAI intends to appoint a maximum of six (6) framework members under Lot 5.
For further information please see Request for Tender at www.etenders.gov.ie.

cac:SubordinateAwardingCriterion.cbc:Description: AC 1: Demonstrated organisation expertise with regard to the subject area
AC 2: Quality of the approach and resources to ensure effective delivery of the services
AC 3: Contract Management and Capacity to Deliver
AC 4: Cost of Service

cac:ProcurementProject.cbc:Name: Community Energy Technical Advisory Service
cac:ProcurementProject.cbc:Description:
Lot 6: Community Energy Technical Advisory Service. The purpose of this Lot is to put in place a specialist technical advisory service for the SEC Network. This will provide a support platform for the provision of current up to date information across all home, business, transport, and community energy supports including technical queries and, any changes to legislation, grant programmes as they arise. This role will also support attendance at regional and national level events as required by SEAI. It is envisaged that this service will operate through SEAI platforms but will be managed and operated by the appointed provider. SEAI intends to appoint a maximum of one (1) framework member under Lot 6.
For further information please see Request for Tender at www.etenders.gov.ie.
